timeline.message:
Extracted deckDropDownItemChanged to allow tests

Roboelectric previously threw a StackOverflow due to an infinite loop
in setting the position.

CardBrowser: Initial Unit Tests

We want to modify the card selection status, keep some initial tests
which do not need to change

Add 'Select None' as well as 'Select All'

This allows both Select All and Select None to be displayed when some,
but not all cards are selected.

Add "Select All" to Browser when in Single Select

Fixes #5464

Consolidates state update for selection updates to onSelectionChanged()

Adds "Select All" to the single-select screen which uses the same
mechanism and same ID as the multiselect "Select All"

This also removes the state where clicking "Select None" moves the user
to a multiselect with no items selected.

Add "Select All" to Browser when in Single Select

Fixes #5464

Consolidates state update for selection updates to onSelectionChanged()

Adds "Select All" to the single-select screen which uses the same
mechanism and same ID as the multiselect "Select All"

This also removes the state where clicking "Select None" moves the user
to a multiselect with no items selected.

timeline.bodyText: This button had two purposes, we split it into onSelectAll and onSelectNone
timeline.author: david-allison-1

timeline.bodyText: I've seen in one other place that async tasks are sometimes working on CardBrowser member variables, and a clear causes NPEs and ConcurrentModExceptions - how would you feel about changing this from .clear() to creating a new empty object? Feels like a defensive programming improvement to me
timeline.author: mikehardy

replies.bodyText: It's an improvement, but it hides the problem. Is there a reason we're not using a concurrent structure for this instead?
replies.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: no reason in particular :-), in general because concurrency is hard - and simply throwing the old object on the GC (either now, or when async task is finished) seems so easy...
replies.author: mikehardy

replies.bodyText: Flipped to a concurrent structure. Doesn't look too painful in this instance
replies.author: david-allison-1
